list.name: Changes
list.comment: change environment to linux for development

task.summary:
Add vcs.xml and modify main() function
Added a vcs.xml file for version control mappings. Refactored main() function in main.c to enhance readability and added functionality to blink Red and Green LEDs.
The vcs.xml was necessary to handle version control system mappings and enable the use of Git. With respect to the edits in main.c, indentation style has been changed to improve code clarity. Also, added code segments to enable blinking of Red and Green LEDs along with the existing Blue LED, thereby making better use of the RGB LED module.

Add utility and log files, refactor main function
Added new utility files 'tools.c' and 'tools.h' for providing a delay function that can be used throughout the application. Created logging related .c and .h files for enabling debug and error messages for better troubleshooting. Refactored main() function to include the new utility and log files.
The delay function is a critical utility requirement, often used in embedded systems programming for synchronization. The logging files are essential for providing detailed insights during troubleshooting by outputting log messages of different severity levels (Debug, Info, Warn, Error). Main() function refactoring has been done to keep code organized and better structured.

"Added USART functionality
Implemented USART functionality in usart.h, usart.c, and stm32l4xx_hal_uart.h. Implemented functions for handling UART, initializing UART, and handling relevant GPIO. This should enable communication over UART."

"Switched UART peripheral from USART2 to USART1
Changes have been made across multiple files to switch from USART2 to USART1. The motivation behind this update is to accommodate for the hardware redesign where the peripheral device now connects to USART1. Corresponding changes have also been made in the logs to use USART1 for debug message transmissions."

Added RT-Thread SDK for the board and modified related files.
This commit includes adding RT-Thread SDK to the project and modifying related files accordingly. These changes are necessary to utilize RT-Thread real-time operating system's functionalities for this project. Changes include new configuration files, assembler, C and XML source files.

Enable AT communication and other network configurations
Enabled the use of 'System Work Queue', 'Software Layer(AT)', and Net Device in RT-Thread configuration. Enabled ESP8266 AT device for WiFi communication and set related configs. Updated include directories and the source files in the CMakeLists. Made corresponding header file changes.
These changes were needed to include AT commands and configure network communication in the RT-Thread real-time operating system. Now the system can use AT commands to communicate with the WiFi module ESP8266 and perform related network tasks.

Add vcs.xml and modify main() function
Added a vcs.xml file for version control mappings. Refactored main() function in main.c to enhance readability and added functionality to blink Red and Green LEDs.
The vcs.xml was necessary to handle version control system mappings and enable the use of Git. With respect to the edits in main.c, indentation style has been changed to improve code clarity. Also, added code segments to enable blinking of Red and Green LEDs along with the existing Blue LED, thereby making better use of the RGB LED module.

Add utility and log files, refactor main function
Added new utility files 'tools.c' and 'tools.h' for providing a delay function that can be used throughout the application. Created logging related .c and .h files for enabling debug and error messages for better troubleshooting. Refactored main() function to include the new utility and log files.
The delay function is a critical utility requirement, often used in embedded systems programming for synchronization. The logging files are essential for providing detailed insights during troubleshooting by outputting log messages of different severity levels (Debug, Info, Warn, Error). Main() function refactoring has been done to keep code organized and better structured.

"Added USART functionality
Implemented USART functionality in usart.h, usart.c, and stm32l4xx_hal_uart.h. Implemented functions for handling UART, initializing UART, and handling relevant GPIO. This should enable communication over UART."

"Switched UART peripheral from USART2 to USART1
Changes have been made across multiple files to switch from USART2 to USART1. The motivation behind this update is to accommodate for the hardware redesign where the peripheral device now connects to USART1. Corresponding changes have also been made in the logs to use USART1 for debug message transmissions."

Added RT-Thread SDK for the board and modified related files.
This commit includes adding RT-Thread SDK to the project and modifying related files accordingly. These changes are necessary to utilize RT-Thread real-time operating system's functionalities for this project. Changes include new configuration files, assembler, C and XML source files.

add lcd driver
open LCD device spi3.0 on the spi3 bus, use based utils functions

Enable AT communication and other network configurations
Enabled the use of 'System Work Queue', 'Software Layer(AT)', and Net Device in RT-Thread configuration. Enabled ESP8266 AT device for WiFi communication and set related configs. Updated include directories and the source files in the CMakeLists. Made corresponding header file changes.
These changes were needed to include AT commands and configure network communication in the RT-Thread real-time operating system. Now the system can use AT commands to communicate with the WiFi module ESP8266 and perform related network tasks.
